 I. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎צָרַח‎</span> **verb** ==cry, roar== (Late Hebrew ***id., cry*** (of raven); Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***ƒarâ—u***</u></abbr>, ***cry aloud***, Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎צְרַח‎</span> Aph\`el (of bear), Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> especially Aph\`el and derivatives ); — 

**Qal** ***Participle active*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַר צֹרֵחַ שָׁם גִּבּוֺר‎</span> [[Zeph.1.14|Zeph 1:14]] ***bitterly roareth there a hero***, but abrupt in context and improbable; [[BDB#Gr|Gr]] (in part after [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]]) conjectures <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִצְרַח כַּגִּבּוֺר‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎קוֺל י‎</span> (compare **Hiph\`il**). **Hiph\`il** ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יַצְרִיחַ‎</span> [[Isa.42.13|Isa 42:13]] ***utter a roar*** (of <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span>, going to battle; \|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יָרִיעַ‎</span>).
